image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: Alex Ophel is accused of attempting to murder two female students at the Australian National University in September 2023.

title.children: Lawyers for man accused of attempted murder at ANU campus say he will plead not guilty

image.altText: A crowd safety officer looks over the crowd at Summernats 2024 in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The two men will face court later this month after footage of an alleged brawl went viral on social media during the 2024 Summernats car festival.

title.children: Crowd safety workers charged with offences relating to alleged brawl during Summernats

image.altText: A black and white photograph of a hovercraft on a lake with onlookers.

props.synopsis: It’s 60 years since Canberra saw backyard tinkerers take to the water on homemade contraptions.

title.children: This drought-stricken Canberra lake was more of a puddle when it hosted the world's first hovercraft race

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers in the corridors of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Federal Treasurer Jim Chalmers says there will be no 'big cash splashes' in the May budget, warning a decline in iron ore prices and a softening labour market will impact the bottom line.

title.children: 'No big cash splashes' in budget but windfalls will be spent, Chalmers says

image.altText: The word Cranbrook in gold on a sandstone column at the gates of a school.

props.synopsis: As both the federal government and Cranbrook announce investigations into the prestigious boys' school, Four Corners has been inundated with new concerning allegations.

title.children: Four Corners' Cranbrook investigation saw its headmaster resign. Now new allegations are flooding in

image.altText: Machinery in a grey dirt field where a gold mine is.

props.synopsis: Kilometres of tunnel stretch beneath the city of Ballarat where a man has died in a rockfall. It's not the first incident the company has seen sparking safety concerns.

title.children: Here's what we know about Victoria's fatal rockfall at Ballarat Gold Mine

image.altText: A man is seen bleeding from his head while emergency services are on board

props.synopsis: There are reports the sudden movement experienced on a LATAM Airlines flight to Auckland on Monday was due to the movement of a cockpit seat.

title.children: Cockpit seat movement reportedly under scrutiny after LATAM Airlines sudden drop

image.altText: A woman with a gun.

props.synopsis: Regular Israelis are taking up arms in record numbers in the wake of the October 7 attack. It's left some Palestinian citizens of Israel fearful.

title.children: Israeli mum Yamit just bought her first handgun, but her attempt to demonstrate it didn't go to plan

image.altText: A close up of hundreds of colourful ribbons tied to a fence outside a church

props.synopsis: Lower courts have accepted that on the balance of probabilities, the assistant priest assaulted the boy. But the Catholic Church is challenging its liability for the abuse.

title.children: High Court to decide if church liable for child sexual abuse in regional Victoria five decades ago

image.altText: A picture of a girl and an older woman hugging and posing for a photo

props.synopsis: Amelia Grozdanovski has been waiting more than a decade for answers about her mother Lorrin's disappearance. She says the high-profile case of Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy leaves her wondering why police still haven't found her mum.

title.children: The search for Samantha Murphy has transfixed the nation. Amelia wants to know why her mum's disappearance didn't

image.altText: A graphic showing different types of drugs overlaid on blocks.

props.synopsis: The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission's latest wastewater drug use report sheds light on how the illicit drug market varies across the country.

title.children: Which Australian city consumes the most cocaine? A new report exposes the country's drug habits

image.altText: Two men and a woman walk outside a court building

props.synopsis: Former Nine News Adelaide sports presenter and AFL star Warren Tredrea has lost his unfair dismissal court case against his former employer.

title.children: Warren Tredrea loses unfair dismissal case against Channel 9

image.altText: A woman holds up sign outside of Capitol Hill reading #KeepTikTok

props.synopsis: The US House of Representatives passes a bill that could spell the end of TikTok for US users. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: TikTok faces an ultimatum in the US: sell or get banned. But how did it get to here?

image.altText: A close shot of Dutton's face, partially lit.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has called for powers to take down harmful online content to be extended to social media posts "glamorising" violence and criminal activity, with new offences to punish those who "post and boast".

title.children: Dutton pushes to criminalise social media posts 'glamorising' crime, with powers to take down content

image.altText: WA rescue composite

props.synopsis: Authorities are contending with poor weather conditions as they try to retrieve seven people who have been found alive after becoming stranded for days in WA's flooded outback.

title.children: Operation underway to rescue group of seven stranded in WA's flood-stricken outback

image.altText: Three women and four children eat off a plate amid rubble in Rafah.

props.synopsis: Israel is planning to tell 1.4 million displaced Palestinians trapped in the southern city of Rafah to seek shelter in central Gaza ahead of a planned military offensive into the south.

title.children: Israel planning to direct 1.4m displaced Palestinians in Rafah to 'humanitarian islands' in central Gaza

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 ended lower on Thursday, dragged down by the big four banks despite a boost in the mining sector, while Singtel has clarified speculation about selling Optus for $16 billion. Look back on the day's business and financial news as it happened with our blog.

title.children: Singtel clarifies rumours of $16 billion Optus sell-off, treasurer upbeat about economy ahead of federal budget, ASX ends lower — as it happened

image.altText: A person walking a dog down an outdoor path from behind.

props.synopsis: A major Australian review finds exercise shouldn't just be an add-on treatment for depression and the benefits might be heightened if you've never tried a downward dog or deadlift before.

title.children: What's the best exercise to help treat depression? That answer changes if you're a man or woman

image.altText: A lady sitting on a porch with documents

props.synopsis: The Tax Office is owed tens of billions of dollars worth of income tax debts it once dismissed as being "uneconomical to pursue". It's a shock for many taxpayers to now have the debts resurrected, in some cases after more than a decade.

title.children: 'The Tax Office wants to take my family home': New debt collection strategy leaves taxpayers like Adriana 'inconsolable'

image.altText: Gina Rinehart stands in front of advertising for an event media conference.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces a major funding package for a project that will become Australia's first combined rare earths mine and refinery, north of Alice Springs, which the government says will be vital for the nation's position in global markets.

title.children: $1b in taxpayer aid slated for Rinehart-backed rare earth mine in Central Australia

image.altText: A woman wearing a long sleeved pink and khaki top stands in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: How many older Australians is the government willing to squeeze to help fund a bigger and better aged care sector? And how hard is it willing to squeeze them? asks David Speers.

title.children: The government is preparing to squeeze older Australians on aged care costs — and the opposition is keeping unusually quiet

image.altText: A man in a black hoodie looks at the camera as he appears to hold a mobile phone up to his ear.

props.synopsis: A killer driver's actions which resulted in the death of father-of-four Timmy Rakei are labelled "appalling" and "shameful" by a County Court judge.

title.children: 'A tragedy of this magnitude was only a matter of time': Court hears of deadly hit-and-run driver's track record

image.altText: Donald Trump stands infront of a United States flag wearing a suit at a podium.

props.synopsis: A judge in Georgia has dropped three counts against the former president over claims he tried to overturn his election defeat in the state in 2020.

title.children: US judge drops three criminal charges against Donald Trump in election subversion case

image.altText: South Korean troops marching.

props.synopsis: Australia has long struggled to recruit as many personnel as our defence force chiefs would like. But ours isn't the only military in the Asia-Pacific region facing issues.

title.children: Australia's military is struggling to fill its ranks. But we're not the only ones

image.altText: Josh Cavallo on his left knee proposing to Leighton Morrell at Hindmarsh Stadium.

props.synopsis: A-League Men player Josh Cavallo thanks Adelaide United after getting engaged to his partner on the pitch at Hindmarsh Stadium.

title.children: 'It felt right': Trailblazer Cavallo announces engagement at Adelaide United's home ground

image.altText: A covered walkway at a primary school.

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old has been charged after he allegedly made physical contact with students at a Sunshine Coast school.

title.children: Charges laid against alleged primary school intruder after five children 'picked up'

image.altText: An unidentifiable woman with curly hair looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: First Nations woman Lisa* was removed from her family when she was six. She relived the trauma when her six-week-old daughter was taken from her. She wants the cycle to stop.

title.children: Law firm lodges human rights complaint over removal of Indigenous children

image.altText: A group of women screaming and cheering in the front row of a concert.

props.synopsis: A few years ago, author and journalist Tabitha Carvan became obsessed with British actor Benedict Cumberbatch. It taught her the importance of female joy.

title.children: From Beatlemania to Swifties: Why female fans aren't taken seriously, but males are considered 'experts'

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: A jury finds Chinese national Jie Shao guilty of manslaughter after she illegally performed breast surgery on clinic owner Jean Huang in 2017 in inner-city Sydney.

title.children: Woman found guilty of manslaughter after fatal breast procedure in Sydney clinic

image.altText: An aerial view of hundreds of tents set up on brown sand across a stretch of land with a blue sky in the distance.

props.synopsis: Some who have had visas cancelled are now stuck in foreign countries where they have no legal status and cannot return to Gaza.

title.children: Several Palestinians left stranded and distressed after Australian visas suddenly cancelled

image.altText: Polio survivor Paul lying down in an iron lung with a glass of water next to his head

props.synopsis: The Texas resident became an inspirational figure, graduating from law school and writing a memoir despite spending more than 70 years inside an iron lung.

title.children: Polio survivor Paul Alexander, who lived for decades in an iron lung, dies aged 78

image.altText: Olivia Rodrigo on the opening night of her GUTS World Tour. in a silver two piece

props.synopsis: Fans have applauded the move form the singer, who is contributing proceeds from her Guts tour to an abortion fund.

title.children: Olivia Rodrigo hands out free contraception at concert in abortion-banned state

image.altText: A film still of Katy O'Brian and Kristen Stewart sitting close together, in 80s-style outfits, on a gym floor.

props.synopsis: Love Lies Bleeding is an instant entry into the queer heart-throb canon, arriving after years of gnawing hunger for complex female antiheroes.

title.children: Blood lust meets queer heart-throb canon in this noir revenge thriller starring Kristen Stewart
